@@ -0,0 +1,96 @@
+# Go-eCharger Binding
+
+This Binding controls and reads data from the [Go-eCharger](https://go-e.co/). It is a mobile wallbox for charging EVs and has an open REST API for reading data and configuration.
+
+## Supported Things
+
+This binding supports go-eCharger HOME+ with 7.4kW or 22kW.
+
+## Discovery
+
+There is no auto discovery. You need to get the IP from the Go-eCharger and put it into the configuration.
+
+## Thing Configuration
+
+The thing has two configuration parameters:
+
+| Parameter | Description                                                              |
+|-----------|------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
+| ip        | the ip-address of your go-eCharger |

timeline.bodyText: Please make use of UoM (i.e. Number:Current), also applies to the other channels

@@ -0,0 +1,96 @@
+# Go-eCharger Binding
+
+This Binding controls and reads data from the [Go-eCharger](https://go-e.co/). It is a mobile wallbox for charging EVs and has an open REST API for reading data and configuration.
+
+## Supported Things
+
+This binding supports go-eCharger HOME+ with 7.4kW or 22kW.
+
+## Discovery
+
+There is no auto discovery. You need to get the IP from the Go-eCharger and put it into the configuration.
+
+## Thing Configuration
+
+The thing has two configuration parameters:
+
+| Parameter | Description                                                              |
+|-----------|------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
+| ip        | the ip-address of your go-eCharger |
+| refreshInterval  | Interval to read data (in seconds) |
+
+## Channels
+
+Currently available channels are 
+| Channel ID | Item Type    | Description              |
+|------------|--------------|------------------------- |
+| maxAmpere | Number | Max ampere allowed to use for charging |

+	xsi:schemaLocation="https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description/v1.0.0 https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description-1.0.0.xsd">
+
+	<thing-type id="goe">
+		<label>Go-eCharger Binding Thing</label>
+		<description>Go-eCharger thing that represents the wallbox configuration and readings</description>
+
+		<channels>
+			<channel id="maxAmpere" typeId="amp" />
+			<channel id="pwmSignal" typeId="pwm" />
+			<channel id="error" typeId="err" />
+			<channel id="voltageL1" typeId="vl1" />
+			<channel id="voltageL2" typeId="vl2" />
+			<channel id="voltageL3" typeId="vl3" />
+			<channel id="currentL1" typeId="cl1" />
+			<channel id="currentL2" typeId="cl2" />
+			<channel id="currentL3" typeId="cl3" />
+			<channel id="powerL1" typeId="pl1" />
+			<channel id="powerL2" typeId="pl2" />
+			<channel id="powerL3" typeId="pl3" />
+			<channel id="phases" typeId="pha" />
+			<channel id="sessionChargeConsumptionLimit" typeId="scl" />
+			<channel id="sessionChargeConsumption" typeId="scs" />
+			<channel id="totalConsumption" typeId="eto" />
+			<channel id="allowCharging" typeId="alw" />
+			<channel id="cableEncoding" typeId="cbl" />
+			<channel id="temperature" typeId="tmp" />
+			<channel id="firmware" typeId="fmw" />
+			<channel id="accessState" typeId="ast" />
+		</channels>
+
+		<config-description>
+			<parameter name="ip" type="text" required="true">
+				<label>IP Adress</label>
+				<description>The IP adress of the Go-eCharger</description>
+			</parameter>
+			<parameter name="refreshInterval" type="integer" required="false">
+				<label>Refresh Interval</label>
+				<description>Refresh interval for acquiring data from Go-eCharger</description>
+			</parameter>
+		</config-description>
+	</thing-type>
+
+	<channel-type id="ast">
+		<item-type>String</item-type>
+		<label>Access State</label>
+		<description>Current access state of the go-eCharge</description>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="amp">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Max Ampere</label>
+		<description>Max ampere per phase allowed to use for charging</description>
+		<state pattern="%d A" readOnly="false"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="pwm">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>PWM signal status</label>
+		<description>Signal status for PWM signal</description>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="err">
+		<item-type>String</item-type>
+		<label>Error Code</label>
+		<description>Error code of Go-eCharger</description>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="vl1">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Voltage L1</label>
+		<description>Voltage on L1</description>
+		<state pattern="%d V" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="vl2">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Voltage L2</label>
+		<description>Voltage on L2</description>
+		<state pattern="%d V" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="vl3">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Voltage L3</label>
+		<description>Voltage on L3</description>
+		<state pattern="%d V" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="cl1">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Current L1</label>
+		<description>Current on L1</description>
+		<state pattern="%.1f A" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="cl2">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Current L2</label>
+		<description>Current on L2</description>
+		<state pattern="%.1f A" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="cl3">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Current L3</label>
+		<description>Current on L3</description>
+		<state pattern="%.1f A" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="pl1">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Power L1</label>
+		<description>Power on L1</description>
+		<state pattern="%.1f kW" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="pl2">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Power L2</label>
+		<description>Power on L2</description>
+		<state pattern="%.1f kW" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="pl3">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Power L3</label>
+		<description>Power on L3</description>
+		<state pattern="%.1f kW" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="pha">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Phases</label>
+		<description>Amount of phases currently used for charging</description>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="scl">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Current Session Charge Limit</label>
+		<description>Wallbox stops charging after defined value, deactivate with value 0</description>
+		<state pattern="%.1f kWh" readOnly="false"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="scs">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Current Session Charge Amount</label>
+		<description>Amount of kWh that have been charged in this session</description>
+		<state pattern="%.1f kWh" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="eto">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Total Charge Amount</label>
+		<description>Amount of kWh that have been charged since installation</description>
+		<state pattern="%.1f kWh" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="alw">
+		<item-type>Switch</item-type>
+		<label>Allow Charging</label>
+		<description>If true charging is allowed</description>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="cbl">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Cable Encoding</label>
+		<description>Specifies the max amps that can be charged with that cable</description>
+		<state pattern="%d A" readOnly="true"></state>
+	</channel-type>
+	<channel-type id="tmp">
+		<item-type>Number</item-type>
+		<label>Temperature</label>
+		<description>Temperature of the Go-eCharger</description>
+		<state pattern="%d °C" readOnly="true"></state>

@@ -0,0 +1,101 @@
+# Go-eCharger Binding
+
+This Binding controls and reads data from the [Go-eCharger](https://go-e.co/).
+It is a mobile wallbox for charging EVs and has an open REST API for reading data and configuration.
+
+## Supported Things
+
+This binding supports go-eCharger HOME+ with 7.4kW or 22kW.
+
+## Discovery
+
+There is no auto discovery.
+You need to get the IP from the Go-eCharger and put it into the configuration.
+
+## Thing Configuration
+
+The thing has two configuration parameters:
+
+| Parameter | Description                                                              | Required |
+|-----------|------------------------------------------------------------------------- |----------|
+| ip        | the ip-address of your go-eCharger | yes |
+| refreshInterval  | Interval to read data, default 5 (in seconds) | no |
+

I might be wrong, but I think the purpose of this command is to retrieve current value for given channel directly from the device, so I would call refresh() here.

replies.bodyText: REFRESH is only triggered once when the channel is linked. Bindings should support REFRESH but in this case I think we can ignore it. There is no additional benefit of refreshing and you can't refresh a single channel anyway. This would require quite some logic to get it right, so better remove it.

timeline.bodyText: Why would you need to retry immediately? Your refreshJob does retries just by virtue that it is periodic.

replies.bodyText: The idea is to not set null values immediately but try again in case there was just a short connection issue. So only after the next retry values are set to null/undef. Took this over from fronius binding. I guess the values are a bit more stable like this in shaky wifi connections.
replies.author: SamuelBrucksch

replies.author: SamuelBrucksch

replies.bodyText: The channel is of QuantityType, but I am talking about passed command. I believe you can send whatever command you want using rules. Also, when there is new command introduced, something similar to REFRESH command, you will get cast exception here.
replies.author: druciak

replies.bodyText: Ok i get it. But then it gets quite complicated, command can be either string, or number or whatever. If you send StringType "6" or  DecimalType 6 it could both work. Guess i have to write a wrapper method that checks for the command and returns something.
replies.author: SamuelBrucksch

replies.bodyText: No. Commands are strongly typed in openHAB. Checking for instanceof QuantityType is enough. Commands send from rules are correctly casted before.
replies.author: J-N-K

replies.bodyText: Ok so i do not have to do anything here? Will quickly check with a custom rule...
replies.author: SamuelBrucksch

replies.bodyText:
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.types.DecimalType cannot be cast to org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.types.QuantityType

So i guess i have the wrong type here anyway.
replies.author: SamuelBrucksch

replies.bodyText: However if i send a string in the rule instead of an int value it still says decimaltype in the exception, so i guess no need to check for different types.
replies.author: SamuelBrucksch

replies.bodyText: Changed type to decimaltype and tested a rule with string and number and both worked.
replies.author: SamuelBrucksch

replies.bodyText:
This is what I do: check type before casting, because the value comes fron the outside and there is no guarantee it will be of proper type. It happened to my binding (satel) when REFRESH command had been introduced - the binding was crashing on this command because there wasn't type checking in one handler.
But if you feel that this is not needed here, just leave as it is.

I just found how to define UoM in rules here:

So i wrote this code in a rule to test it:
var current = 5|A
var mA = current.toUnit("mA")
GoEChargerBindingThingMaxAmpere.sendCommand(mA)

This causes an error, however GoEChargerBindingThingMaxAmpere.sendCommand(mA.intValue) works, GoEChargerBindingThingMaxAmpere.sendCommand("5000") also works and both are converted to DecimalType.
So to me it looks like it is not possible to send a QuantityType as command. Or am i doing anything wrong here?

timeline.bodyText:
Since all String states are known, you can add state options for these. That makes them translatable and it allows them to show up nicer in UIs:
		<state readOnly="true">
			<options>
				<option value="OPEN">Open</option>
				<option value="RFID">RFID</option>
				<option value="TIMER">Timer</option>
				<option value="AWATTAR">aWATTar</option>
				<option value="UNKNOWN">Unknown</option>
			</options>
		</state>
See also: https://www.openhab.org/docs/developer/bindings/thing-xml.html#state-description
